However, Christianity has a strong tradition of breakfast as a sacred meal, with many early Christians gathering for breakfast after the resurrection of Jesus. In fact, the word "breakfast" itself comes from the Old English words "brecan" (to break) and "faste" (fast), referring to the act of breaking one's fast at the beginning of the day. So, while all the other options may have a strong tradition of eating breakfast, the Christian tradition places a particularly high value on this meal.
